text: The electoral district of Kentish was a single-member electoral district of the Tasmanian House of Assembly. It centred on the town of Sheffield in Tasmania's north, inland from Devonport. The seat was created in a redistribution ahead of the 1903 state election from the southern part of West Devon and smaller parts of Devonport, and was abolished when the Tasmanian parliament adopted the Hare-Clark electoral model in 1909. It had a single member during its existence, John Hope, who had previously represented the seat of Devonport and went on to represent the new Wilmot division. ==Members for Kentish== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Member!!Term |- | | John Hope | 1903–1909 |} ==References== * * * Parliament of Tasmania (2006). The Parliament of Tasmania from 1956 Kentish
title: Electoral district of Kentish
